3.name: Narration
3.text:
In a space filled with the scorching heat of
molten lava and the smell of sulfur, a massive
figure looms. Just the movement of that figure
exudes such an overwhelming pressure that one
would want to flee.

4.name: Narration
4.text:
Terrifyingly sharp fangs, scales dyed in crimson,
and eyes filled with tyranny. This is the
appearance of the tyrant who has lived since
ancient times...!

8.name: Adventurer
8.text: "And it's not even a joking matter... Ancient...?"

10.name: Red Dragon
10.text:
"If I thought the noise was bothersome... it was
these rats? The ones who disturbed my sleeping
place."

12.name: Red Dragon
12.text:
"..........? Oh... This unpleasant smell... It's
quite nostalgic, isn't it? The offspring of that
detestable golden dragon, Clouslutinaus...?"

14.name: Sol
14.text:
"Could it be... you... you... are... my
mother...?!"

15.name: Red Dragon
15.text:
"I have been tormented by that wretch for so
long... but the scream when I tore off its head
was exquisite...! It seems you will also provide
me with some amusement!!!"

21.name: Adventurer
21.text: "Damn, my blade won't stand... quite literally..."

23.name: Adventurer
23.text:
"...nuh... ugh, somehow. I am alive, but I doubt
anyone else is unharmed."

26.name: Red Dragon
26.text:
"Hmph, is this all you've got? Well, for a chick,
you've certainly put up quite a fight, haven't
you?"

27.name: Red Dragon
27.text:
"Well, I was planning to torment you a little
longer for my own amusement, but I'll show you
mercy. Be grateful as I'll put you out of your
misery with one bite!!"

29.name: Narration
29.text:
The moment the Red Dragon opened its massive jaws
to bite and kill Sol, a light resembling lightning
painted the space white.

31.name: Narration
31.text:
When the flash disappeared and the blinding white
light faded, the figures of the golden dragon and
the small-tempered adventurers had already
vanished. It seemed that the intruders had rescued
them, the red dragon realized.

33.name: Narration
33.text:
I ponder. To think that they were able to face the
red dragon, who has been immersed in battle since
ancient times, and stealthily lead out that many
adventurers, they must be quite formidable.

34.name: Narration
34.text:
Normally, just the existence of such a
troublemaker would have been enraging, causing the
red dragon to throw a tantrum and rampage,
destroying three or four human settlements.
However, the red dragon remained unusually calm.

35.name: Narration
35.text:
He is extremely arrogant and short-tempered, but
he readily admitted that the intruders were
troublesome opponents. This slight humility was
indeed his strength that had allowed him to
survive until today.

36.name: Narration
36.text:
Well, it's fine. It will take some time to heal
from the battle wounds and molt. At that time,
I'll devour that small golden dragon. The power
difference is such that I can take and devour that
clever little dragon anytime. The pleasure should
be saved for later. With that thought, he coiled
up and began to breathe heavily again.

38.name: Narration
38.text:
The kobolds, who had been pessimistic that half of
their tribe would be burned to death in a fit of
rage, were surprised but couldn't help but feel
grateful for the miracle of the chief not throwing
a tantrum and quietly falling asleep again.
